source: Course – Inspired by LinkedIn Learning’s 'Problem-Solving Techniques for Developers' & Coursera’s 'Storytelling for Influence'
Course – Inspired by LinkedIn Learning’s 'Problem-Solving Techniques for Developers' & Coursera’s 'Storytelling for Influence'

level_1: Courses show why explaining your problem story is useful.
Lessons teach how to describe what you solved step by step.
Students learn to tell what was the challenge and solution.
They see how to write a simple code story in plain words.
level_2: Courses explain sharing your approach in a team.
They teach how to break complex code into easy steps.
Students learn to show blockers and how they fixed them.
Lessons guide adding lessons learned in the story.
This helps in group discussions and mock interviews.
level_3: Courses show how seniors explain tough bugs to juniors.
Lessons guide sharing solutions in reviews or meetings.
Students learn storytelling for coding blogs or talks.
They practice turning mistakes into learning points.
This helps stand out during hiring rounds.
level_4: Courses teach leading problem-solving sessions in teams.
They guide helping juniors craft clear code stories.
Lessons explain presenting your work to non-tech teams.
Students learn to share narratives that inspire trust.
This builds leadership talk skills.
